attributes.action: Make ULEZ and LEZ payments last 24 hours from time of payment, not 00:00 -23:59
attributes.additional_details:
With TFL and the government charging you day by day (00:00 - 23.59pm), a lot of people ware caught out, as was I with the thought that a payment would last 24 hours from time of payment.
The current payment system essentially means that, at present, a driver could pay at 23:59 one day and then if driving at 00:01 the day after (just 2 minutes since payment), they would be fined by TFL. 

Link on change.org;

https://chng.it/SWwFxJRN4R
attributes.background:
It is essential that the way payments work for congestion charging MUST change.  
Having made a payment, from that moment of entry, we should automatically be given a 24 hour pass to use our vehicles within the congestion charging zones across London and all other low emission zones across the UK.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about the time of operation of congestion and low emission zones are a matter for the relevant local authority, not the UK Government or Parliament.
